signals.core
Class PlottingMath

java.lang.Object
  signals.core.PlottingMath

public class PlottingMath
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements mathematical static methods useful for making plots

Author:
Juliet

                               double[] input_extrema)
finds the minimum and maximum values in the array, essentially including minVal and maxVal as elements in the array

Parameters:
array -
extrma - an array with the current min at index 0 and the current max at index 1
Returns:

compareExtrema

public double[] compareExtrema(double[] extrema1,
                               double[] extrema2)
Given two sets of extrema, returns the most extreme

Parameters:
extrema1 - {min1,max1}
extrema2 - {min2,max2}
Returns:
{min(min1,min2), max(max1,max2)}

contrastAdjustExtrema

                                             double adjustment)
if there is no difference between minVal and maxval, subtract some amount from minVal and add it to maxVal

Parameters:
extrema - an array with the current min at index 0 and the current max at index 1
Returns:

mathToPlotCoordinates

public double[][] mathToPlotCoordinates(double[] xData,
                                        double[] yData)
Converts data to be plotted into coordinates that can be painted on a graph

Parameters:
width - the width of the graph in pixels
height - the height of the graph in pixels
offset - size of the empty border around the graph in pixels
xData - data to be plotted along the horizontal axis
yData - data to be plotted along the vertical axis
xExtrema - minimum and maximum values to be shown on x axis
yExtrema - minimum and maximimum values to be shown on y axis
Returns:
the x and y coordiates to be painted on a graph, plus the origin, in plotting coordinates
